.
Peterson was a Presidential scholar at the University of North Dakota and graduated summa cum laude. She holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree with a major in German, minor in English, and minor in secretarial studies and office administration.

Congratulations to Aiden Krogh, a senior at Red River High School, on receiving a perfect score of 36 on the ACT college entrance exam!

The ACT assesses students in English, mathematics, science, and reading. The scores in each area are compiled together into a composite score, which has a range of 1 to 36.

Also receiving perfect ACT scores were Kali Bjornson (Devils Lake), Philip Dowdell (Fargo), Alexander Heiser (Bismarck), Sean Joyce (Bismarck), Joanna Lin (Fargo), Forrest Weintraub (Fargo), Allen Wu (Fargo), and Ellie Zentner (formerly of Bismarck).

‚ÄúIt is a rare event for a student to get the highest score possible on the ACT,‚Äù said Kirsten Baesler, North Dakota state school superintendent. ‚ÄúIt takes study and hard work as well as intellectual gifts. We should be proud of the North Dakota students who were able to accomplish this. These nine students are truly among our best and brightest.‚Äù

Krogh will be attending Washington University in St. Louis, Mo. to study engineering.

The National Association of Music Merchants (NAMM) Foundation has designated Grand Forks Public Schools as one of the Best Communities for Music Education for 2020!

Now in its 21st year, the Best Communities for Music Education designation is awarded to districts that demonstrate outstanding achievement in efforts to provide music access and education to all students. To qualify for the Best Communities designation, each school district answered detailed questions about funding, graduation requirements, music class participation, instruction time, facilities, support for the music programs.

Grand Forks Public Schools joins Bismarck, Fargo, and Mandan as the only four districts in North Dakota to receive the designation in 2020.

The NAMM Foundation selected 754 school districts across the United States to receive the honors.

This is the 18th year Grand Forks Public Schools has received the designation from the foundation.

The School Boards are particularly interested in having a broad and diverse representation of the community involved in this work.

For more information, and to complete the online application, please visit https://www.gfschools.org/site/Default.aspx?PageID=8974. Paper applications are available at the Mark Sanford Education Center (2400 47th Ave. S).

Applications are due no later than 4 p.m. CST on February 24th, 2020.

The Grand Forks and Grand Forks Air Force Base Public School Districts will hold a joint public forum on February 10 at 7 p.m. at South Middle School (1999 47th Ave. S).

The topics being discussed will focus on community engagement relating to the development of a long-range master facility plan.

The forum is open to the public. Forum documents can be found online at https://www.gfschools.org/Page/8973. Attendees are encouraged to bring their own device to access the documents online during the forum. A limited number of devices will be available following the forum to complete an exit question.

It's a wonderful week to thank a school counselor! This week is National School Counseling Week, and the counselors at Grand Forks Public Schools work hard every day to implement a comprehensive school counseling program. Our counselors have a tremendous impact in providing students with academic, college/career, and social/emotional development.

To learn more about our counseling program, please visit: https://www.gfschools.org/domain/29

If you are in a school this week, please take a moment to thank our school counselors for all of the wonderful things they do!

(photo courtesy Tana Thorfinnson)
